intro: Nauclea nitida, commonly known as the white nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. The plant has smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Nauclea nitida is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
